Yakuza 4 Remastered is a singleplayer third-person action, brawler, mini-games and open world game in the Yakuza series.

Key points

The PC version is missing the Pachinko mini-game found in the console versions.[1]

General information

Steam Community Discussions

Availability[edit]

Source DRM Notes Keys OS
Remastered Collection also available.
Humble Store
Microsoft Store
Xbox Game Pass for PC
Steam

Essential improvements[edit]

SilentPatch[edit]

Reduces CPU usage.
Removes a low level keyboard hook potentially causing issues with slow typing speed.
Fixed a potential random startup crash.
Fixed several issues related to non-ASCII user names.
Only works for Steam version, incompatible with Microsoft Store version, unless sideloading the game files with something like UWPDumper.

Game data[edit]

Configuration file(s) location[edit]

System Location
Windows %APPDATA%\Sega\Yakuza4\
Microsoft Store
Steam Play (Linux) <Steam-folder>/steamapps/compatdata/1105500/pfx/[Note 1]

Save game data location[edit]

System Location
Microsoft Store %LOCALAPPDATA%\Packages\SEGAofAmericaInc.Yakuza4PC_<ALPHABETS>\SystemAppData\wgs
Steam <Steam-folder>\userdata\<user-id>\1105500\remote\
Steam Play (Linux) <Steam-folder>/steamapps/compatdata/1105500/pfx/[Note 1]

Transferring Microsoft Store saves to the Steam version[edit]

The Microsoft Store save game data location should contain folders which lead to files with hexadecimal names that are either 119KB or 128KB in size.

The 128KB file is the save\system.sys file in the Steam save game data location.

Each 119KB file is either a savegameX.sav or a savegameX.clr (created after beating the game) file in the Steam save game data location, where X is the index of the save, starting at 1.

Which Microsoft Store save is which index can be deduced using the "Date modified" property of the file and the in-game save date.

Transfer is done by copying files from the Microsoft Store location to the Steam location and renaming the copied files correctly.

Depth of field[edit]

Disable DoF in cutscenes and first person mode[citation needed]
  1. Install Yakuza 4 3D Vision fix.
  2. Run the game, and press F4 to toggle depth of field. Not disabled by default.

Localizations

Language UI Audio Sub Notes
English
The English Karaoke Lyrics option is available. If turned off, Japanese Kanji and Romaji lyrics are displayed. If turned on, English lyrics will be displayed.
Traditional Chinese
Traditional Chinese lyrics are displayed in Karaoke.
Japanese
Japanese lyrics are displayed in Karaoke. Two selectable font types are available.
Korean
Korean lyrics are displayed in Karaoke.

Issues fixed[edit]

The code execution cannot proceed because MFPlat.DLL was not found. Reinstalling the program may fix this problem[edit]

The issue is due to N versions of Windows, because it has no built-in Media Features Pack.
Install Media Feature Pack[citation needed]
  1. Install Media Feature Pack that matches your Windows version

Other information[edit]

API[edit]

Technical specs Supported Notes
Direct3D 11
Executable 32-bit 64-bit Notes
Windows

Yakuza 4 Restoration Patch[edit]

Restores licensed music that was cut from the western version of Yakuza 4, as well as higher quality videos from the PS3 version, uncensors certain lines of dialogue in a scene during the game's first chapter, and restores Masayoshi Tanimura's original appearance and Japanese voice.
Use restoration patch[2]
  1. Download Yakuza 4 Hiroki Narimiya Restoration Patch. Alternatively, if you desire to keep the Yakuza 4 Remastered version of Tanimura but want all the other benefits from the mod, download Yakuza 4 Licensed Music and Uncensor Restoration Patch.
  2. Unpack the files to <path-to-game> and overwrite when prompted.

High Resolution Font for Yakuza 4[edit]

Replaces the font in the game with the same official higher resolution text font.

Notes

  1. 1.0 1.1 File/folder structure within this directory reflects the path(s) listed for Windows and/or Steam game data (use Wine regedit to access Windows registry paths). Games with Steam Cloud support may store data in ~/.steam/steam/userdata/<user-id>/1105500/ in addition to or instead of this directory. The app ID (1105500) may differ in some cases. Treat backslashes as forward slashes. See the glossary page for details.
